content.description: Confident crimps and side pulls bring you to the slightly over hang section of hard to read crimps and tricky moves to reach the 3 finger pocket that gets you to the lip.
content.location: The second TR problem on the wall to the climbers right when walking in the Adventure Supply Alley

content.description: Boulder up the triangles up and out to the lip of the roof and get keep your cool. Place your first piece and make your way through unique pockets and holds. Single rack, Sling the tree at the top. Spicy start and a pump to the top.
content.location: To the left of Tarantula, over hanging start with a sand pit bottom!

content.description: Super fun and engaging way to teach first timers how to lead/lead belay! funky mantel at 3rd bolt is the only risky move.
content.location: The first sport route on the chill arete of the large detached "Juice Box" boulder.

content.description: Shares anchors with Tipsy Turvy but follows the bolt line on the slabby side of the "Juice Box". Avoid using the arete and stay on them feet!
Weird dihedral start with a spicy first micro/nut placement. Make your way up and out of dihedral to better holds and placements to the anchors
content.location: Making your way around the cliff line from Adventure Supply Alley this climb is around the corner of Rat Trap past Pygmy Up on the right in the dihedral just before you reach an obvious roof/overhanging start with a sand pit at its base.

content.description: Fun fist/foot sized crack that tackles a bulgy crux onto the face of the bluff.  Single rack will do (room for creative placements) or a few 3s and a 4. Walk-off, build an anchor, or tree anchor.
content.location: Obvious foot sized crack on the wall around the corner of the Adventure Supply Alley. "Rat-Trap"  a horizontal V4 Traversing boulder problem finishes at its base. A stuck turtle shell inside the bottom end of the crack will confirm you are at the right spot.

content.description: Use the Obvious side pull rail into micro crimps and a sharp pocket to make your way the face near the arete into the dihedral up into the base of the roof.
content.location: The third set of top-rope anchors on the wall to the climbers right while walking in the Adventure Supply Alley.

content.description: Been done as a highball with a pad and as a Trad Route with 2 large cams. Tree anchor.
content.location: Large Obvious Off-Width in the crack around the corner of the main Adventure Supply Alley Area.

content.description: Crimps, Pockets, Side-pulls, Underclings...this Highball can be set up as a Top-rope spot to teach newer climbers how to pull on different holds(learn the language). There are several ways up the face of this detached pillar-like boulder, either way holds a challenge. Has/can be done as a highball for anyone looking to get in a spicy/heady burn on a lower grade boulder.TR recommended.
content.location: This climb is located next to the approach laid out in the AR 2nd Ed. Guidebook. From the Adventure Supply Alley approach this climb is located on the back side of a large "crack" you walk through after passing "Tri-strangulation".

content.description: Sit start into a large horizontal crack and traverse your way around the sharp edge until  you end in a mantle at the base of Shredder's Revenge. Toe/Heel hooks will give you the rest you need when the pump hits.
content.location: The large horizontal crack at the base of the wall Shredders Revenge is located.

content.description: Make your way up the low angle wall placing gear in horizontal cracks along the way. Good holds and confident feet get you to the anchors at the top. Single Rack up to 4
content.location: After passing around the corner from the wall that holds the large low lying horizontal crack 'Rat-Trap v3/v4'  This route is located on the right. A large pyramid shaped boulder will be at your back.

content.description: Fun hand jams and good holds on the face of this climb pull you up and over 2 distinct bulges while working this crack. Mostly hand sized cams, small placements could be used in the start.
content.location: Located on the BACKSIDE of the "juice box" boulder. Either jump across, walk around, or drop in the gap next to Tipsy Toes and make your way under the "juice box"  to reach the base of the crack.

content.description: Fun boulder start into easy terrain brings you to a show down with a crimpy hold resembling the state of California on a blank slightly over hung wall. Commit to a chill Dino to the lip.
content.location: The first of the 3 top-rope problems on the wall to the climbers right while walking in the Adventure Supply Alley

content.description: This area is not mentioned in the 2nd Edition of the AR Guide Book and holds a few burley TR problems, beginner sport, bouldering, and moderate trad.
